item.title: CS152-lecture-20210603
item.description: Data programming # Count the number of even chars # in C # #include <stdio.h>#include <stdint.h> int num_even(void * p, int nbytes) { uint32_t * p32 = (uint32_t *) p; int nitems = nbytes / 4; int acc = 0; for (int i = 0; i < nitems; i++) if (p32[i] % 2 == 0) acc = acc + 1; return acc; } int main() { uint8_t buf[] = {0xFF, 0x00, 0xFF, 0x00, 0xFF, 0x00, 0xFF, 0x00}; printf("%d\n", num_even(buf, 8)); return 0; } Depending on the endian, the output is either 0 or 2.
